column1: Primero de Enero is a municipality and town in the Ciego de Ávila Province of Cuba. Originally named Violeta
column2: its name means "1st of January" in Spanish
column3: and is referred to the final day (in 1959) of Cuban Revolution.

column1: Located in the eastern side of its province
column2: it borders with the municipalities of Esmeralda
column6: Morón (30 km far) and Bolivia. The town is 57 km far from Ciego de Ávila
column8: and 112 from Camagüey. The municipal territory includes the villages as Corea

column2: the municipality of Primero de Enero had a population of 27
column3: 813. With a total area of 713 km2 (275 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 39.0/km2 (101/sq mi).
